alert.note: Alert for Spokane Area; Washington Palouse (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 06 at 6:59AM PST until January 06 at 4:00PM PST by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...HEAVY SNOW AND FREEZING RAIN TODAY... .Moderate to heavy snow is impacting the Inland Northwest this morning. Snowfall rates around Wenatchee, Chelan, Omak, and into the East Slopes of the Cascades have been very heavy and on the order of 1 to 2 inches per hour. All Cascade Passes are closed at this time. ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM PST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Additional snow accumulations of 3 to 5 inches. Storm total snow accumulations between 5 and 8 inches and ice accumulations around a light glaze. * WHERE...Colfax, Worley, Cheney, Fairfield, Hayden, Airway Heights, Downtown Spokane, Spokane Valley, Moscow, Tekoa, Uniontown, Oakesdale, Rockford, Rosalia, Coeur d`Alene, La Crosse, Post Falls, Davenport, Potlatch, Plummer, Genesee, and Pullman. * WHEN...Until 4 PM PST this afternoon. * IMPACTS...The hazardous conditions could impact the Thursday morning commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Areas of freezing rain will be possible over the Palouse and parts of Spokane county Thursday afternoon and evening before temperatures warm above freezing overnight Thursday.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
